replies.body: We haven't seen DOOM BOTS in a while, what is up with that?

A Jinx with tons of attack speed, 100% crit and deals tons of bonus damage and gets faster when they crit AND THEN ALSO gains damage for their bonus movement speed. That's just gonna be broken.

i think it might be to do with coding all the newer champ and how to make the game not break.

Honestly, I hate playing a champ to the point where you get bored of them. When URF rolled around, I was playing pretty much every champ I knew I could use. I don't see how people have fun picking the same champion every game just because they're OP...

But let's be real here, making this random is just gonna make people rage quit in the pick phase if they don't get/trade for the champ they want, and then rage quit in-game if their team is completely outmatched compared to the enemy team.

That doesnt happen very much at all in aram so why would it happen a lot in this new mode. A lot of people pushed for RNG URF after the second time it game out and everyone just spammed out the same champs. 

Honestly URF was only fun for me the first time it came out, after that I couldnt try new champs in urf mode without being stomped my ahri's and sonas.

I do believe that this is the right direction but still feel like the smaller twisted tree line or Howling abyss would be better maps for the chaos.

Honestly I agree with Pacification, people will be more inclined to quit in the picking phase, imagine you get in are are given a champ like yasuo, or darius. Really any champion you think you wouldn't have fun with. Honestly I think it will be alot better once you get 10 or so bans.

Another issue would be what happens when the other team gets a team with, zed, azir, eve, alistar, etc. and your team gets worse champs. Then the game stops being fun. At least aram is easier to balance.

It's a really good idea but it means that players who enter URF queue wanting to try a particular champion (not just{{champion:8}} or{{champion:28}} ) they're stuck playing a champion that they, A. Don't know how to play B. Personally don't enjoy or C. Are not very good in the URF game mode alone. A solution to this would likely be to make two separate queues: one for those who want all random and don't want those same highly contested picks every game, and one for those who don't mind the same champions every game but want to have their own choice in choosing whichever champion they desire to play.
Either way it's still not a bad idea nonetheless. c: ily Rito
How about you give us the original Urf riot, and then made the number of Bans 5 per team, for a total of 5? Then noone will spam broken picks as much
I personally don't like the random champion idea but I would rather have 5 bans on each team. So people can enjoy playing the champs they want and also not have op champs in every game.

I rather like that idea. Have like the new ranked pick system as to how the bans (3-5) are distributed, then once the banning phase is over, dump both teams with a set of random champs, bar the ones banned.

So instead of picking champs you wanna try you're making it RNG to get the perceived 'OP' champs? How is that going to fix it, if anything it'll make it purely luck whether or not you get a good champion on or not. What if you get yasuo and you're pretty much useless compared to other champs? Am I meant to suffer through a 20min+ game most likely doing nothing and getting no kills? What if your team is unlucky enough to get all the bad champs and your enemy get all the good champs. Winning would be completely based on luck and that really shouldn't be the case. I can't fathom how anyone would like this change, do you want games to be won based of RNG? Cause that's how it's going to be with this change.

The dragons have this issue too, if your team is lucky enough to get a 2 infernal drakes in a row, your team has a pretty much won all the teamfights. If your team gets multiple mountain drakes in a row, objectives will melt in seconds. It influences the game A LOT and completely RNG based. Once a team is ahead and gets these drakes, there's pretty much no coming back and winning a game from behind is one of the best feelings, now gone due to them just being lucky for that game.

Nemesis Draft is by far my least favorite gamemode. The games go for way too long and nobody knows how to have fun.

Sooo.... if it was so stagnant and "boring" why are so many people asking for it back, prompting you to post the most popular question "We haven’t seen URF mode in a while, what is up with that?"

If people were sick of it, why are they asking for it, and why change it if no one was asking for it to be changed.

The real question is, was the community bored with it, or Riot? I think the latter

Nah. A lot of the community found it very boring, mainly because the League Of Legends community doesn't know how to have fun. URF is nice once and a while, but over and over it does become boring. People ask for it back, but only because they can spam the OP Champions like Zed with no concerns. We have not seen it in a while, so it is only natural people will be asking "What is going on?" 

Riot wasn't bored of it, they were just aware of how unhealthy of a gamemode it can become. People ask for Hexakill to come back, the same goes with One For Alls. 

Those gamemodes however are a lot easier to balance in a lot of aspects, so they come back more often. People were asking for URF to be changed, because the spamming of the same 20 champions became very monotonous. People want Doom Bots back now don't they? But I'm sure if it was put in 3 weekends in a row people would get a little bit tired of it. 
RNG URF has been a requested idea since the creation of the gamemode, you clearly just haven't been around long enough.

But it's just a merri-go-round, mention any RGM and there will be a fan section, and a haters section all arguing about which is best. Of course **some** would get sick of doom bots 3 weekends in a row. But why would you make it 3 weekends in a row anyway? Thats just silly.

If you read the comments section for every RGM update they post, there are always people complaining about "Not poro king again we've had this too many times put something else on", "We hate nexus siege its boring" etc etc (not to be specific about those 2 modes, just examples).
The point is they are holding 1 popular RGM back so it doesn't stagnate, but leaving others in to become stagnate.

I personally haven't been around long enough no, but many of my friends migrated to league from the get go, and most of them either hate all RGM's and just don't bother playing them, or want a schedule that puts every mode in, in an equal amount of times. To the latter I couldn't agree more.

The best way to not make any 1 single thing stagnate or boring, is to have greater variety. And what better way to have more variety than not having 1 more than another, distribute them evenly to the masses. If more modes are created, great add them in. But keep the old ones too. Some will play it, some wont. I honestly only hate ascension, the rest i don't mind. But i'd be happy to have ascension in the queue just as much as the other modes, because i'm sure others really enjoy it.

Riot is preaching variety here by changing a mode that was rarely seen and already waited upon anyway, but why not make the whole thing (RGM) a variety, not just a small portion of it (1 mode).

Stagnant and boring are two different things, but Stagnant gameplay can lead to it being boring. While a lot of people were picking Champions just to have fun, even more people were picking Zed every game because he was "OP" which isn't very fun to verse and making it All Random fixes that.
